isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3000FE, 3000RE - 3000RE GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: Engine Oil Pressure Gauge
svcsubproc.para: When the engine is running, the ECM supplies a 5 volt signal to the engine oil pressure sensor through circuit 97CY. The sensor then provides a variable voltage signal to the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Level Gauge
svcsubproc.para: The fuel level gauge is powered whenever the key switch is on, through circuits 13, 13F, fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28B, the green cluster connector (11), and the cluster printed circuit board. The gauge is grounded through the printed circuit board, the green connector (11), circuits 28-G, 11-GB, and 11-G to the platform ground.

Current flows from the fuel level gauge to the fuel sender (37) through the printed circuit board, green connector (11), circuit 36, dash connector (2), and circuit 36. The sender ground is through 36-G and 11-G to the platform ground.

svcsubproc.title: Voltmeter Gauge
svcsubproc.para: The voltmeter gauge is powered whenever the key switch is on, through the ECM and the ATA data-link circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Tachometer Gauge and Speedometer Gauge
svcsubproc.para: Refer to the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual for operation of the Tachometer and Speedometer system.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Coolant Temperature Gauge
svcsubproc.para: The engine water temperature gauge is driven by the ECM through the ATA data-link circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Low Oil Pressure/High Water Temperature/Low Coolant Level Lights and Alarm
svcsubproc.para: Refer to the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual for operation of the warning light and alarm system.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure Warning Light and Alarm - With Air Brake System
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (20) is turned on, power is applied to circuit 13/13F, fuse F22, circuit 28/28D, dash connector (12), the instrument cluster printed circuit board, the brake warning light, the circuit board, connector (12), circuit 40A, and to the fast mode side of alarm (211).

When the vehicle is started and the air pressure is below 60 psi, the air pressure switch (1LA) is closed and provides a ground path for the alarm and warning light through circuit 40, the platform/chassis connector (2), circuit 40, the chassis/engine harness connector (196), circuit 40, and through the closed air pressure switch (1LA) which is grounded through its mounting.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure Warning Light and Alarm - With Hydraulic Brake System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Hydraulic Brake System in the Chassis Accessories Section of this manual.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Brake Low Fluid and Parking Brake Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (20) is turned to the on position, power is supplied to the low brake fluid warning system through circuit 28, to a splice, circuit 90R, the low level fluid warning light (89), circuit 90V, to a splice, platform/ chassis connector (2) and (90A), and circuit 90P to the normally open sensor switch (90). When a low brake fluid level is encountered, the sensor switch closes and the circuit ground is through the switch and circuit 11-GF/11-GB to the platform ground.

When the key switch is turned to the start position, a momentary ground is applied through the key switch, circuit 31-GD, circuit 44-G, brake diode assembly (82), circuit 90W to the previously mentioned splice, and circuit 90V to the fluid level warning bulb. This causes the warning light to come on as a bulb check and goes off when the key is released from the start position.

Power is also applied to the parking brake warning system through circuit 28/28C, connector (12-8), to the warning light, connector (12-17), circuit 44, brake diode assembly connector (82) and circuit 44A to the normally open parking brake switch (218). When the parking brake is applied, the switch contacts close and completes the circuit through the switch and circuit 44-GA/11-GB/11-G to the platform ground.

When the key is turned to the start position, a ground is applied to the circuitry through the ignition switch, circuit 31-GD, circuit 44-G, brake diode assembly (82) and circuit 44 to the park brake bulb. This causes the warning light to come on as a bulb check and goes off when the key is released from the start position.

svcsubproc.title: Diagnostic/Programming Connector and Self-Test Switch and Warning Light System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual for operation of the Diagnostic/Programming Connector and Self-Test Switch and Warning Light System.

svcsubproc.title: Wait-to-Start Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: Refer to the appropriate Engine Diagnostic Manual for a description of the warning light system.

svcsubproc.title: Transmission Oil Temperature Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch (20) in the on position, power is available at the transmission warning light switch through fuse F22, circuit 28/28E, the warning light, and circuit 31 to platform harness connector (2). The circuitry continues through circuit 31, the chassis/engine harness connector (196) and circuit 31 to the temperature switch terminal.
When the transmission oil temperature reaches 305°F (151.7°C) or more, the switch contacts close and completes the ground path. This causes the warning light to come on.

svcsubproc.title: Change Transmission Filter Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on position, power is available at the automatic transmission fuel filter connector (344) through fuse F10, circuit 31D, Pall filter warning light connector (94), and circuit 31-GA. The circuitry continues through a blue wire in the jumper harness which connects to the black wire of the filter pigtail.

When the key switch is turned to the start position, the circuit is momentarily grounded through the filter pressure differential switch contacts, the switch pigtail white wire, the green wire of the jumper harness, and the filter connector (344). The ground path continues through circuit 31-GB, rectifier assembly (64), circuit 31-GC, an inline connector (N/L), and circuit 31-GD to the key switch (20) ground. This activates the warning light and serves as a bulb operating check when starting the vehicle.

When the flow of oil through the filter is restricted, the filter pressure differential switch is activated. This grounds the warning light through the switch contacts, the red wire of the pigtail, the brown wire of the jumper harness, connector (344) and circuit 11-GE to the platform ground.
